meanings.definition: A person who revokes or cancels something.
meanings.sent1: The revoker of the contract decided to cancel the agreement.
meanings.sent2: The revoker was responsible for annulling the membership.
meanings.sent3: The revoker of the permission slip accidentally tore it up.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the revoker of all fun, always canceling plans last minute.
meanings.sent5: The revoker of the prize made sure no one received the award.

meanings.definition: To officially cancel or withdraw something.
meanings.sent1: He had to revoker his offer due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to revoker the outdated policy.
meanings.sent3: She had to revoker her promise to attend the event.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to revoker all hopes of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The judge had to revoker the decision after new evidence came to light.
